title: The shirts are here...
body: The shirts are here! The only problem is, the stickers haven't arrived yet. So what should I do? Send the shirts and buttons this week, and send the stickers later... OR... wait until the stickers arrive and send everything at once? Such a dilemma.
author: Dan

comments.author: Tom G.- Ex Coworker
comments.body:
Do what saves you the most money, there is no rush.   I was hoping to wear my new t-shirt to the Horseradish Festival in Collinsville in June, so there is some time.  Congrats on the budget relief !!

take care
tom

comments.author: Craig
comments.body: Is that a Dr Pepper in your pocket, or are you just glad to see me?

comments.author: Stephanie
comments.body: We can wait...save the postage.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
"Hey Jerry...

8 Ball."

Puddy was the BEST.

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body:
Just wait Dan, postage is an expense you need little of.

I'll just print an oversized version of the "Dr. Pepper Money Shot" to hang on my wall in the meantime.

comments.author: Matt
comments.body: if you aren't shooting a gun or about to pilot a helicopter, you nned to take off those glasses, man.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Matt... you sound jealous.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: Or you could ride your motorcycle alongside a runway, pumping your fist and crying "Woo-hoo!" as an F-14 takes off.

comments.author: nicole
comments.body: Awww, I think he looks fine. And happy to see everyone, that's for sure.

comments.author: Sam Spade
comments.body: Captain Badass rides again!

comments.author: Steve Kirks
comments.body: Can I come down to the theater and buy a shirt?  Are you working down there tonight?  Can I gaze longingly into the windows and sigh?

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Dan, you look AWESOME!

comments.author: Rachel
comments.body: You should really convince Nicole to be in some pictures...it's starting to seem like you have an ego or something...

comments.author: steph v.
comments.body: Lookin sharp! That's what my dad used to tell us when we looked good.

comments.author: justin
comments.body: I've seen Nicole push old women and chldren out of the way to get away from cameras!  Just kidding, of course. LOVE YOU NICOLE!

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Nicole doesn't like having her picture taken. That's why she refuses to do any of the televised news pieces with me.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Is she 

-afraid the camera will steal her soul?  

-running a global crime syndicate?

-merely afraid it will wash out her natural color?

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Or all of the above?

A superstitious, vain drug lord as not as unlikely as one might think.  Remember Scarface.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Or all of the above?

A superstitious, vain drug lord as not as unlikely as one might think.  Remember Scarface.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Or all of the above?

A superstitious, vain drug lord as not as unlikely as one might think.  Remember Scarface.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
Things are funnier when repeated thrice.

(Not my fault!  Benzo is screwing with the site!)

comments.author: nicole
comments.body:
I just like being the photographer. And you saw what happens when Dan's behind the camera - lots of pictures of construction and the longest Phlog post ever.

But if it makes Rachel feel better, I'm sure we can find a senior picture of me in sunglasses somewhere...No. No we can't.

comments.author: Nikki
comments.body:
I stumbled on your site yesterday...great!  I am finishing up a faux business plan (what a pain) for a class.  My idea is  similar to what you guys are doing, and it has been a great help so far.  I saw where you posted your old layout for the two screen concept, but do you have one for the new version?
Thanks

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body: I would like to note that seeing more of nicole on-camera would not be a bad thing.

comments.author: Trint
comments.body:
Steve Kirks said:

"Can I come down to the theater and buy a shirt? Are you working down there tonight? Can I gaze longingly into the windows and sigh? "

And I second his inquiry. About the shirts, that is. I come down and gaze longingly into the windows five nights a week, permission or no.

comments.author: bjork24
comments.body: Steve & Trint: You can buy the shirts on the blog, or drop by when I'm there working. Just let me know when you plan on dropping by. We won't be there tomorrow night.

comments.author: Jo
comments.body: stickers and pins now! I want my shirt, it's too cool to wait for.

comments.author: nathan springer
comments.body: you should wait and save money, but if people want the shirts set up a time for people to come by and get them. it could be a cool time to meet people and maybe see the theater. just an idea.

comments.author: J.R.
comments.body: I was rockin' mine last night, and Dan's Aunt came up to me and said hello.

comments.author: Al
comments.body: The pop in the pocket look...priceless.

comments.author: Steve Croxton
comments.body: I think Mr. Springer has a good idea. Set up a time whence we might pick `em up. Then do the same thing when the pins & stickers arive. Good PR. Hey, if I bring my silver Sharpie, you could sign it!
